content:
Hi Rustaceans!, I'm Rod, a MS in Industrial engineer, recently work as Data Scientist with python/julia mostly and now forking some algorithm and testing on Rust, really love this language, right now I'm not an expert on rustlang but i love spend hours on daily basis learning this beautiful language. Recently spend 20@25 hours on this language for compile some algorithm in rust and using/calling in python, Rust language it's awesome.

I really interesting to make some performance papers comparing operative research algorithm in rustlang with others languages and share or publish. Let me know if there some scientific team in Rust community to get into.

Thank you for all replies in advance,

Rod.

Hi @rsepulveda! We have #t-lang/wg-unsafe-code-guidelines which about formal and informal specification of what is UB and what is not. For performance we have #t-compiler/performance. On #t-compiler/wg-incr-comp there was a topic yesterday/today about searching for literature regarding codegen unit partitioning and other things important for the performance of incremental compilation.

bjorn3 said:

Very helpful, thank you @bjorn3 !! I'm glad be in here!.
